credit_line: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 211 x 85 cm (6 ft. 11 1/16 in. x 33 7/16 in.)
Warp x Weft (i): 149.7 x 86.2 cm (58 15/16 x 33 15/16 in.)
Repeat H: 61 cm (24 in.)
title: Jeanne d'Arc
provenance: from the Richard Cranch Greenleaf Collection.
medium:
Medium: cotton (confirmed through microscope)
Technique: printed by engraved plate on plain weave.
description: Cotton, plate-printed in red; six scenes from the life and martyrdom of Jeanne d'Arc.  Her march on Paris; her arrow wound being dressed; the capture of the Tourelles; Jeanne praying before the Shrine of St. Catherine; captured with her brothers and brought before Philip, the Good; her burning at the stake in Rouen.
name: Textile
